intro: Daphnopsis occidentalis, commonly known as the western daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soil, often at high altitudes. Its ornamental value is due to its compact growth habit and seasonal color changes in its foliage. However, it is not widely cultivated and remains a relatively obscure species in horticultural circles.
